intro: Tristaniopsis callobuxus, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and palmate leaves. The tree produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are clustered in rounded inflorescences. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Tristaniopsis callobuxus is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
